all_questions.question: What is the formal equivalence between synchronous tree substitution grammars and synchronous context-free grammars?
all_questions.context: The good thing is that the synchronous tree substitution grammars are actually formally equivalent.

all_questions.question: How can the inner structure of subtrees be condensed in synchronous tree substitution grammars?
all_questions.context: Because what you can do is you can condense all this inner structure of these subtrees and only increase the set of non-terminals that you use.

all_questions.question: What is the purpose of using a special non-terminal VP in synchronous tree substitution grammars?
all_questions.context: So we could use a special non-terminal VP which includes PP, P and N and has these terminals in love then.

all_questions.question: How do the productions in synchronous tree substitution grammars match across languages?
all_questions.context: The set of productions in this contents tree will match across the languages.

all_questions.question: What is the main goal of generalization in synchronous tree substitution grammars?
all_questions.context: But that is not the type of generalization that we are after.
